description: From Latin increpatus, past participle of increpare (“to upbraid”); prefix in- (“in, against”) + crepare (“to talk noisily”).

verbs.description: increpate (third-person singular simple present increpates, present participle increpating, simple past and past participle increpated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To chide; to rebuke; to reprove.
